Docs.summary: Returns a textual explanation of the query.
Docs.returns: A textual string describing the query or how the query will be performed.
Docs.remarks: This method is provided for debugging or for users to be able to optimize the query based on the information in the returned string.

Docs.summary: The index of the first binding to return.
Docs.value: The index of the first binding to return. The value of this property is 1-based.
Docs.remarks: The first binding returned is by default the first binding.

Docs.summary: The number of bindings to return.
Docs.value: The maximum number of bindings to return, or -1 to return all bindings.
Docs.remarks: All bindings are returned by default.

Docs.summary: A filter on the Meta value of statements in the target graph considered by the query.
Docs.value: The value of this property is by default, meaning the Meta field of statements in the target graph is ignored for the purposes of the query. Otherwise, the query is restricted to statements with the given entity as a Meta value.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Run (SemWeb.SelectableSource source, SemWeb.Query.QueryResultSink resultsink);

Docs.summary: A Query is something that returns all of the ways a set of variables may bind to a graph. This is the abstract base class of several query methods.

remarks.para: The class provides a query algorithm to match a graph with variables against another graph.
The class provides a SPARQL query engine.
